resources.string: Wear a mask in public, especially indoors when physical distancing is not possible.
Maintain a safe distance from others (at least 2 metre or 6 feet), even if they don\'t appear to be sick.
Stay home if you feel unwell.
Clean your hands often. Use soap and water, or an alcohol-based hand rub, or sanitizer.
Get vaccinated when it\'s your turn. Follow local guidance about vaccination.
Cover your nose and mouth with your bent elbow or a tissue when you cough or sneeze.
CARRY CLEANERS // Antiviral wipes // Alcohol pads // Hand sanitizer //(if you can find //some) //Keep them in your car so you //have them handy, and carry //them around when you go out.
Wash your hands for at least //20 seconds with soap and water, //especially after using //the restroom.
Avoid leaning against walls, counters, and railings. Do not sit on floors or steps.
Limit the number of surfaces you touch especially when you are in public place.
We know it’s tough— but keep your hands off your face, eyes, mouth, and hair.
Especially all high-touch surfaces in your home and car. Also, be sure to clean your hands before and after entering your home and car.
Check that you have wear mask properly.Make sure your mouth and nose are cover. To check click on check button to open camera and check.
Antiviral wipes, Alcohol pads and Hand sanitizer (if you can find some) Keep them in your car so you have them handy, and carry them around when you go out.
Wash your hands for at least 20 seconds with soap and water, especially after using the restroom.
